required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing Discontinuation Symptoms Of DVS SR In Subjects With Major Depressive Disorder (MDD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel Group Study To Compare Discontinuation Symptoms In Abrupt Discontinuation Versus A 1-Week Tapering Regimen In Subjects With MDD Treated For 24 Weeks With Open-Label 50 mg DVS SR Formulation

brief_summary.textblock: Study Comparing Discontinuation Symptoms in subjects with Major Depressive Disorder treated for 24 Weeks with Open-label 50 mg Desvenlafaxine Succinate Sustained-Release Formulation (DVS SR)

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Total Discontinuation - Emergent Signs and Symptoms (DESS) Score Over the First 2 Weeks of the Double-blind Phase
primary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind phase: Week 1 (Study Day 175), Week 2 (Study Day 182)
primary_outcome.description: Clinician-administered 43-item assessment to evaluate discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from withdrawal from study treatment. Total score=sum of number of new symptoms and old (but worse) symptoms (score=1) and old and unchanged symptom, absent, or old symptom but improved (score=0); total possible range 0 to 43. Higher score=more symptoms. New symptom=any symptom that appeared within 7 days before DESS administration; old symptom=any symptom that appeared 7 days before DESS administration and continued into 7-day period. DESS calculated as 2*mean(of DESSDB Week 1, DESSDB Week 2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Taper Adverse Events (AEs) in the Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind phase: Baseline (Study Day 168) up to Week 4 (Study Day 196)
secondary_outcome.description: Any untoward medical occurrence in a patient who received study drug was considered an AE without regard to possibility of causal relationship. Taper-emergent AEs (TPAEs) are those events which occurred during the double-blind period but did not occur during the last 7 days of the on-therapy period or existed during the last 7 days and worsened in the double-blind period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Were Unable to Successfully Complete Tapering of the Study Drug Because of the Number and/or Severity of Their Discontinuation Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind phase: Baseline (Study Day 168) up to Week 4 (Study Day 196)
secondary_outcome.description: Discontinuation symptoms may occur following abrupt cessation of serotonergic antidepressants in a minority of participants following short-term treatment of an episode of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD). The symptoms include emotional and somatic symptoms such as dizziness, nausea, and paresthesia and typically appear within 2 to 3 days of reducing the dose or stopping the antidepressant medication. Discontinuation symptoms are usually mild and resolve spontaneously within a week in the majority of patients, though a minority can have intense and prolonged symptoms.

intervention.description: DVS SR 50 mg Reference Group/Arm, oral tablet, 2 tablets/day during the first week and 1 tablet/day during weeks 2 through 4 of the double-blind treatment phase.
DVS SR 25 mg Taper Group/Arm, oral tablet, 2 tablets/day during the first week and 1 tablet/day during weeks 2 through 4 of the double-blind treatment phase.
DVS SR Placebo Abrupt Discontinuation Group/Arm, oral tablet, 2 tablets/day during the first week and 1 tablet/day during weeks 2 through 4 of the double-blind treatment phase.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary Diagnosis of Major Depressive Disorder
- Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression-17-Item score of greater than or equal to 14 at baseline
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current psychoactive substance abuse or dependence, manic episode, or a lifetime diagnosis of bipolar or psychotic disorder
- Potentially violent to others or is at significant risk for suicide
- History or current evidence of gastrointestinal disease or history of surgery known to interfere with absorption or excretion
- Known presence of raised intraocular pressure or history of narrow angle glaucoma

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Eligible participants entered a 24 Week Open-label treatment phase; participants who completed the Open-label phase were randomized to a 4 Week Double-blind treatment phase.

group.title: DVS SR 50 mg (Open-label Phase)
group.description: Desvenlafaxine Succinate Sustained-Release Formulation (DVS SR) 50 milligrams (mg) by mouth (PO) once daily (QD) for 24 Weeks.

group.title: DVS SR 50 mg (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: DVS SR 50 mg (reference group): 2 tablets PO once daily (QD) for 1 week (1 tablet DVS SR 50 mg and 1 tablet placebo 25 mg) then DVS SR 50 mg 1 tablet PO QD Weeks 2 through 4.

group.title: DVS SR 25 mg (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: DVS SR 25 mg (taper group): 2 tablets PO QD for 1 week (1 tablet placebo 50 mg and 1 tablet DVS SR 25 mg) then placebo 50 mg 1 tablet PO QD Weeks 2 through 4.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Placebo (abrupt-discontinuation group): 2 tablets PO QD for 1 week (1 tablet placebo 50 mg and 1 tablet placebo 25 mg) then placebo 50 mg 1 tablet PO QD Weeks 2 through 4.

group.title: Entire Study Population
group.description: 24 Week Open-label phase DVS SR 50 mg PO QD followed by 4 Week Double-blind phase: DVS SR 50 mg (reference group), DVS SR 25 mg (taper group), or Placebo (abrupt-discontinuation group).

outcome.title: Total Discontinuation - Emergent Signs and Symptoms (DESS) Score Over the First 2 Weeks of the Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: Clinician-administered 43-item assessment to evaluate discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from withdrawal from study treatment. Total score=sum of number of new symptoms and old (but worse) symptoms (score=1) and old and unchanged symptom, absent, or old symptom but improved (score=0); total possible range 0 to 43. Higher score=more symptoms. New symptom=any symptom that appeared within 7 days before DESS administration; old symptom=any symptom that appeared 7 days before DESS administration and continued into 7-day period. DESS calculated as 2*mean(of DESSDB Week 1, DESSDB Week 2).
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind phase: Week 1 (Study Day 175), Week 2 (Study Day 182)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all randomized participants who had at least 1 postrandomization DESS record. Mean was adjusted for baseline DESS score and study center.

group.title: DVS SR 50 mg
group.description: DVS SR 50 mg (reference group): 2 tablets PO once daily (QD) for 1 week (1 tablet DVS SR 50 mg and 1 tablet placebo 25 mg) then DVS SR 50 mg 1 tablet PO QD Weeks 2 through 4.

group.title: DVS SR 25 mg
group.description: DVS SR 25 mg (taper group): 2 tablets PO QD for 1 week (1 tablet placebo 50 mg and 1 tablet DVS SR 25 mg) then placebo 50 mg 1 tablet PO QD Weeks 2 through 4.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo (abrupt-discontinuation group): 2 tablets PO QD for 1 week (1 tablet placebo 50 mg and 1 tablet placebo 25 mg) then placebo 50 mg 1 tablet PO QD Weeks 2 through 4.

measure.title: Total Discontinuation - Emergent Signs and Symptoms (DESS) Score Over the First 2 Weeks of the Double-blind Phase
measure.description: Clinician-administered 43-item assessment to evaluate discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from withdrawal from study treatment. Total score=sum of number of new symptoms and old (but worse) symptoms (score=1) and old and unchanged symptom, absent, or old symptom but improved (score=0); total possible range 0 to 43. Higher score=more symptoms. New symptom=any symptom that appeared within 7 days before DESS administration; old symptom=any symptom that appeared 7 days before DESS administration and continued into 7-day period. DESS calculated as 2*mean(of DESSDB Week 1, DESSDB Week 2).
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all randomized participants who had at least 1 postrandomization DESS record. Mean was adjusted for baseline DESS score and study center.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference: Placebo versus DVS SR 50 mg
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Null hypothesis: absolute difference between the 2 discontinuation regimens in DESS total scores was >2.5. Alternative hypothesis: absolute difference was ≤2.5; tested by calculating 95% 2-sided confidence intervals (CIs) on the mean difference between the 2 regimens. If absolute values of both confidence limits were ≤2.5, then the regimens were declared equivalent.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference: DVS SR 25 mg versus DVS SR 50 mg
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Null hypothesis: absolute difference between the 2 discontinuation regimens in DESS total scores was >2.5. Alternative hypothesis: absolute difference was ≤2.5; tested by calculating 95% 2-sided confidence intervals (CIs) on the mean difference between the 2 regimens. If absolute values of both confidence limits were ≤2.5, then the regimens were declared equivalent.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference: Placebo versus DVS SR 25 mg
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Null hypothesis: absolute difference between the 2 discontinuation regimens in DESS total scores was >2.5. Alternative hypothesis: absolute difference was ≤2.5; tested by calculating 95% 2-sided confidence intervals (CIs) on the mean difference between the 2 regimens. If absolute values of both confidence limits were ≤2.5, then the regimens were declared equivalent.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Taper Adverse Events (AEs) in the Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: Any untoward medical occurrence in a patient who received study drug was considered an AE without regard to possibility of causal relationship. Taper-emergent AEs (TPAEs) are those events which occurred during the double-blind period but did not occur during the last 7 days of the on-therapy period or existed during the last 7 days and worsened in the double-blind period.
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind phase: Baseline (Study Day 168) up to Week 4 (Study Day 196)
outcome.population: Safety population (Double-blind phase): all participants who received at least 1 dose of study treatment and were randomized into the Double-blind treatment phase.

group.description: DVS SR 50 mg (reference group): 2 tablets PO once daily (QD) for 1 week (1 tablet DVS SR 50 mg and 1 tablet placebo 25 mg) then DVS SR 50 mg 1 tablet PO QD Weeks 2 through 4.

The symptoms include emotional and somatic symptoms such as dizziness, nausea, and paresthesia and typically appear within 2 to 3 days of reducing the dose or stopping the antidepressant medication. reported_events.time_frame: Events collected from the signing of the informed consent form up to 14 days after the last dose of study treatment
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: DVS SR 50 mg (Open-label Phase)
group.description: DVS SR 50 mg PO QD for 24 Weeks.

group.title: DVS SR 50 mg (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: DVS SR 50 mg (reference group): 2 tablets PO once daily (QD) for 1 week (1 tablet DVS SR 50 mg and 1 tablet placebo 25 mg) then DVS SR 50 mg 1 tablet PO QD Weeks 2 through 4.

group.description: DVS SR 25 mg (taper group): 2 tablets PO QD for 1 week (1 tablet placebo 50 mg and 1 tablet DVS SR 25 mg) then placebo 50 mg 1 tablet PO QD Weeks 2 through 4.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
